results.title: Alternate interfaces

constellations_other.name: Dream A Little Crazy: The next stage of human evolution
constellations_other.description: Collaborators Lucy McRae and Rachel Wingfield created a ‘biological bakery’ for Architecture In Helsinki’s "Dream A Little Crazy". Manufacturing a series of mass-produced band members the clip explores speculative science and the future of the human body’s evolution.

results.description: Stelarc’s Alternate Interfaces explores the human/machine divide.
description_for_label: Stelarc’s Alternate Interfaces explores the human/machine divide.

results.title: Altered states
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Howard Gottfried and Ken Russell
results.brief_description: William Hurt is Dr. Eddie Jessup, a scientist obsessed with the most enigmatic of questions: What is God? What is consciousness? How did life begin? His research leads him to experiments with sensory deprivation, schizophrenia, and finally with Native American hallucinogenic drugs which have been used in religious ritual for eons. As his experiments progress Eddie finds himself regressing further into the primordial past and bringing it back into his present. Ken Russell directs with his own hallucinogenic urgency, creating a pop fusion of horror film, psychedelic religiosity, existentialism and sheer knuckle-biting suspense. Wildly misunderstood on its release, “Altered States” is a fascinating movie roller-coaster grounded by a devilish sense of humour which refuses to allow the film to drift into pomposity or kant: this is Frankenstein on LSD. Blair Brown is Dr. Jessup’s equally brilliant but despairing wife. The enigmatic, frightening music score is by renowned composer John Corigliano.

results.title: Altar masterpiece
results.brief_description: During the 15th Century the burghers of Krakow commissioned Wit Stwocz, master wood-carver and sculptor, to create a monumental altar-piece for St. Mary’s church, Krakow, the former capital of Poland. This film describes the altar-piece and its setting in medieval Krakow. It shows how the history of that period, its people, clothes and customs has been woven by Wit Stwocz into the story told in the altar’s carving.

results.title: Alpine vistas: Mt. Hotham
results.creator_credit: Herschells Films and Charles R. Herschell
results.brief_description: A study of Mount Hotham, one of Victoria’s most popular winter-sport resorts. This film gives a glimpse of life in Victoria during the 1930’s.

results.title: Alpine sunshine
results.brief_description: Skiing in the Austrian Tyrol. Little villages of a few houses and hotels which are deserted in summer attract hundreds of tourists for winter sports. From the nursery slopes skiers graduate to the weekly races, full day excursions into the mountains, and long runs down from the top of the chair lift.

results.title: Alpine ranger: Mt. Buffalo National Park
results.brief_description: The Mount Buffalo National Park, north-eastern Victoria, throughout the year, showing visitors skiing, bush walking, climbing and fishing and the work of a park ranger in maintenance, supervision and fire control. No other credits available.

results.title: Alpine Playground
results.creator_credit: Cinesound and Tourist Development Authority of Victoria
results.brief_description: A holiday with a difference; the joys of an alpine winter holiday in Victoria’s picturesque skiing resorts, Mt Buffalo, Mt Hotham and Falls Creek. Within easy reach of Melbourne, facilities include expert ski instruction, readily available ski tows, toboggans, and comfortable accommodation.

results.title: Alpine harvest
results.creator_credit: Cambridge Film Productions and David Bilcock
results.brief_description: A film of the timber industry in the mountainous areas of North-Eastern Victoria. Experts move through the forest, selecting trees to be felled. Then gangs of timber getters move in, felling them, hauling them to the roads, and transporting them to mills.
